intro: Oreopanax morototoni, commonly known as the Taitung oreopanax, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 50 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically pollinated by insects. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
